data.title: Shehnaaz Gill Cries Inconsolably As She Bids Sidharth Shukla Goodbye: How to Cope When a Loved One Dies
data.meta_description: Emotional Shehnaaz Gill, who was very close to Sidharth Shukla was spotted at the actor’s funeral with her brother Shehbaaz. May his soul rest in peace! TheHealthSite.com
data.text:
Emotional Shehnaaz Gill, who was very close to Sidharth Shukla was spotted at the actor's funeral with her brother Shehbaaz. May his soul rest in peace!

The sudden demise of actor Sidharth Shukla at the age of 40 following a massive heart attack has left the industry and his fans in shock. According to the reports, he was brought dead to Cooper Hospital, Mumbai on Thursday. Since the news broke on social media, fans, friends, and colleagues have been sharing heartfelt condolences for the late actor. Sidharth Shukla's performance in 'Balika Vadhu' was praised by many. He also won the Bigg Boss 13 title and his on-screen chemistry with actress and singer Shehnaaz Gill was loved by many. They were lovingly called, 'SidNaaz' by their fans and followers. Hashtag #SidNaz was never out of the trending sight in the last couple of months since they left the Bigg Boss house. The duo was cast in several music albums and was last seen on the Dance Deewane platform. However, the shocking death of the actor has left Shehnaaz in a state of shock and grief. After listening to the news, the actress reportedly left her shooting midway. Speaking to the media, Shehnaaz Gill's father Santosh Singh Sukh said that his daughter is not doing well. "I spoke to her. She is not fine. My son Shehbaaz has left for Mumbai to be with her and I will be going later," he was quoted as saying.

On Friday, Shehnaaz Gill was first spotted outside Shukla's house since the news about his sudden demise broke. A 'completely broken' Shehnaaz Gill was spotted at the Sohiwara crematorium where Sidharth Shukla's last rites are to be done. In the picture, Shehnaaz can be seen sitting next to her brother. Tips To Overcome The Death Of a Loved One

It is very hard to cope with the loss of a loved one. Losing someone close to the heart can be traumatic and stressful. Though coping with the loss of a close one can be deeply personal, here are some steps that can help you to work through your grief over the loss of your loved one.

Allow The Feelings

An emotional breakdown can happen when you lose a loved one, you may feel that you are getting crazy, but that's not the thing. It is ok to feel all the emotions. It's natural to feel this way. Gently remind yourself about the good memories you have with the loved one you have lost and understand that there is no "right" or "wrong" when it comes to your feelings.

Take Some Support From Others

While asking to be left alone after the loss of a loved one is normal, but you should always surround yourself with people who can make you comfortable, with whom you can share your feelings (good or bad). They can be either your friends, family, or anyone who is close to you. Taking support from others can help you deal with the loneliness that may seem alright but can actually lead to depression and sadness.

It Is 'OK' To Cry

It's important to know that every person has their own way of coping with the loss of a loved one. Allowing the process to take place is very important. Remember it is ok to cry. Also, you cannot put a time limit on your grief process. You can feel bad, cry, or even adore the memories for as long as you want. Some of the stages in this whole process can be Denial (you may get numb and refuse to accept the truth), Anger (your rage and anger may sweep in between the process of your grief), Depression ( a very common thing you may notice following your loved one's death and it is okay. just make sure to fight the condition and stay strong), the last stage is Acceptance (you slowly accept the truth and begin living with it).
